content: this legal text summarizes the progress of a cause that lasted for 4 years the judges decision in this case addresses the division of marital property the judge rejects the exhusbands interpretation of the marriage contract and emphasizes that alterations made to buildings using common funds should not exclude compensation for the community the judge also determines that the value of the property should be based on the market value at the time of purchase the case involves parties who were married in 1984 and divorced in 2007 with a community property regime the exwife claims a reward for the increase in value due to significant alterations made by the exhusband the judge supports the exwifes claim and rejects the exhusbands interpretation of the marriage contract the decision also addresses bank balances and the sharing of savings the case was appealed and the decision was upheld the parties involved discuss the progress of a case related to the interpretation of a clause in the marriage contract that would result in major alterations to mr hs property the court determines that the clause should not be broadly interpreted and considers the value of the property and the contribution made by the parties mr h argues that the property was undervalued at the time of marriage but the court rejects his argument the court also concludes that mr h is not entitled to take back his contribution as he failed to provide proof of its use for the benefit of the community the court upholds the previous judgment and orders mr h to pay the costs of the appeal
